intro: Oenothera shimekii, commonly known as the Shimek's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oenothera shimekii is a member of the Onagraceae family and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
